Native to the Mediterranean region and Egypt, cumin seeds are the tiny dried fruit that comes from a small Umbelliferae plant and its taste is earthy, pungent and slightly sweet with citrus undertones. Further, cumin belongs to the same plant family as parsley, carrots, dill, and caraway. In Ayurveda, cumin is used as a digestive and culinary herb and is considered balancing to all doshas.
